# Global Temperature Changes

This analysis explores global temperature anomalies over time, examining trends in global warming and their implications for climate change.

## ðŸ“¦ Load Required Packages

```{r load-packages}
library(tidyverse)      # Data manipulation and visualization
library(scales)         # Scale functions
library(lubridate)      # Date handling
library(viridis)        # Color palettes

# Set theme
theme_set(theme_minimal(base_size = 13))
```

---

## Data Preparation

```{r load-data}
# Load real TidyTuesday data
library(tidytuesdayR)

# Method 1: Using tidytuesdayR package (recommended)
tuesdata <- tt_load('2023-07-11')
temperature_data <- tuesdata$global_temps

# Method 2: Direct URL (if package unavailable)
# temperature_data <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2023/2023-07-11/global_temps.csv')

# Quick exploration
glimpse(temperature_data)

# Clean and prepare data
temp_clean <- temperature_data %>%
  # Filter for annual averages
  filter(!is.na(annual_anomaly)) %>%
  # Create decade variable
  mutate(
    decade = floor(year / 10) * 10,
    era = case_when(
      year < 1950 ~ "Pre-1950",
      year < 1980 ~ "1950-1979",
      year < 2000 ~ "1980-1999",
      TRUE ~ "2000+"
    )
  )

# Preview the data
head(temp_clean)
```



```{r}
# Example plot
ggplot(temperature_data, aes(x = year, y = temperature_change)) +
  geom_line() +
  labs(title = "Global Temperature Changes Over Time", x = "Year", y = "Temperature Change (Â°C)")
```
